official-title.#text: To provide for certain land to be taken into trust for the benefit of Morongo Band of Mission Indians, and for other purposes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Economic Development Through Tribal Land Exchange Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
For the purposes of this Act, the following definitions apply:

term.#tail: means the City of Banning, which is located in Riverside County, California adjacent to the Morongo Indian Reservation.
means Lloyd L. Fields, the owner of record of Parcel A.

quote.#tail: means the map entitled ‘Morongo Indian Reservation, County of Riverside, State of California Land Exchange Map’, and dated May 22, 2014, which is on file in the Bureau of Land Management State Office in Sacramento, California.

term.#tail: means the approximately 41.15 acres designated on the map as
means the approximately 41.15 acres designated on the map as
means the approximately 1.21 acres designated on the map as
means the approximately 1.76 acres designated on the map as
means the Morongo Band of Mission Indians, a federally recognized Indian tribe.

header.#text: Transfer of lands; trust lands, easement

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of confirmation that Fields has duly executed and deposited with a mutually acceptable and jointly instructed escrow holder in California a deed conveying clear and unencumbered title to Parcel A to the United States in trust for the exclusive use and benefit of the Tribe, and upon receipt by Fields of confirmation that the

has duly executed and deposited into escrow with the same mutually acceptable and jointly instructed escrow holder a patent conveying clear and unencumbered title in fee simple to Parcel B to Fields and has duly executed and deposited into escrow with the same mutually acceptable and jointly instructed escrow holder an easement to the City for a public right-of-way over Parcel D, the
shall instruct the escrow holder to simultaneously cause—

text.#text: Subject to any valid existing rights of any third parties and to legal review and approval of the form and content of any and all instruments of conveyance and policies of title insurance, upon receipt by the

text.#text: the patent to Parcel B to be recorded and issued to Fields;
the easement over Parcel D to be recorded and issued to the City; and
